news.title: MetaMask Security Monthly: October 2023
news.subtitle: Countries all over the world recognized Cybersecurity Awareness Month in October. We hope you were able to stay extra safe, but remind everyone to stay vigilant every day of the year.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Victor Frankenstein‚Äôs laboratory from the 1931 film. Happy Halloween!

MetaMask and Blockaid Team Up On Privacy-Preserving Security Alerts to Protect User Assets


MetaMask, in collaboration with Blockaid, a leading web3 security provider, launched security alerts that help stop malicious transactions before they happen, protecting users from scams, phishing, and hacks. MetaMask and Blockaid developed a privacy-preserving module to simulate transactions while removing the need for users to share data with third parties. Based on previous trends, when available to 100% of the MetaMask users, these alerts aim to prevent billions worth of assets from being stolen.

üößWhat We‚Äôve Been Working Onüöß


Open Beta of the LavaMoat Webpack Plugin


We want to encourage developers to try out the plugin and report any incompatibilities with the webpack config or tools you use. It should be plug-and-play with some configurations of what to exclude when processing assets to avoid clashing with the css-extract plugins and such.

Open Beta is the only time where you can get free direct support on your LavaMoat integration, so don't hesitate to get in touch! Start a discussion thread here if you're trying it out and share your experience and showcase results.

https://github.com/LavaMoat/LavaMoat/discussions/723 https://npmjs.com/package/@lavamoat/webpack

X(FKA Twitter) Space: Web3 Security and the Forta Snap


Christian Montoya from MetaMask Snaps joins Christian Seifert and Andrew Beal from Forta to discuss web3 security and the Forta transaction insight Snap.

‚ÄúThe purpose of the Forta Snap is to protect you from scams. The way that it works is that it will screen your transaction before you grant an approval and before you sign it, and it will warn you if an entity that you are interacting with in that transaction is malicious." - Andrew Beal

The snap will return one of two possible warnings: high risk indicates a malicious entity, and low risk means you're probably safe. It was pointed out in the discussion that we hear a lot about large protocol attacks, but the routine attacks on individuals is just as critical to the ecosystem. One user in particular posted about how thankful they were to have been using the Forta snap:

Today I almost got scammed.

I was about to loose 10k.

Thanks to @FortaNetwork MetaMask Snap saved my day.

Let's see how you can prevent this too. ‚¨áÔ∏è pic.twitter.com/NKoeI71OBb

— cryon (@cryoncrypto) October 24, 2023

Communicating Effectively with Victims of Pig Butchering Scams: A Runbook


This collaborative document is intended to serve investigators, exchanges, and crypto product builders who find themselves in the unfortunate position of interacting with users who have fallen victim to a pig butchering scam. Current contributors are the MetaMask Security and Trust & Safety teams, as well as investigators from CryptoForensic.

Pig butchering, or sha zhu pan, scams have been on the rise, and occur when bad actors engage in an online relationship with their victims. Many times, the relationships are romantic in nature, but can also be platonic. As the scammer has taken painstaking months to build up a rapport with the victim, the victim often doesn‚Äôt realize that the person they trusted has stolen from them.

The runbook covers what facts indicate the user has been affected by one of these scams, what questions to ask, and how to most effectively coach them into mitigating further losses.

LavaMoat


  • We have released an early version of LavaMoat Webpack plugin. It is capable of wrapping your code in compartments and adhering to a basic policy. While missing some convenience, it‚Äôs ready for you to test compatibility with your project! You can now get it: npm i @lavamoat/webpack Go to https://github.com/LavaMoat/LavaMoat/discussions/723 to leave your feedback or get support.
  • New major releases of all LavaMoat packages are out. The breaking change is they no longer support Node.js v14.
  • LavaMoat on tour:
    • React Advanced - online - https://portal.gitnation.org/contents/i-run-code-from-the-internet-1520 - Webpack Plugin announced.
    • The Hack summit - Warsaw - https://thehacksummit.com/en/
  • We are improving the quality of our typings, but much more of that is coming.
  • A recent vulnerability was resolved by upgrading to MacOS 13.5.2+ prompted MetaMask Mobile support for Xcode 15 and upgrading to React Native 0.71.14. Now merged, lockdown is undergoing final testing on iOS (JSC), followed by lockdown on Android (Hermes).

Tales of Caution


Fantom Foundation Loses 550K out of 7 Million in Initial Hack


Summary

On October 17, a subset of Fantom Foundation (Fantom) wallets were drained due to private key compromise. Fantom initially broke the news in their Telegram channel claiming the fund loss was the result of a Chrome zero-day exploit, but have not released any supporting evidence. Using on-chain analysis(1, 2, 3) we assess with moderate confidence this attack resulted from compromised private keys. Since this fund loss incident impacted multiple wallets at the same date and time, we can determine that it was unlikely for each key holder to have fallen victim to a phishing attack on the same date and time. Fantom later disclosed in an official statement on X saying that only 550K out of the total $7 million stolen belonged to Fantom Foundation, but never gave any new details shedding light on how the attack occurred.

How users can protect themselves

User‚Äôs funds are safe as this hack only affected employee wallets. I would still advise user‚Äôs to keep a close watch on Fantom Foundation and how they handle this situation. It would also be a great idea for both developers and user‚Äôs to follow Tay‚Äôs advice üëá

  1. Practice good OPSEC - Use MFA, hardware wallets, and don‚Äôt download random things from the internet.
  2. Don‚Äôt put all your eggs in one basket - Distribute assets to different wallets and be sure to rotate your keys(ie, Don‚Äôt use keys of 7+ years or seeds that has been used on multiple devices)
  3. Separate Concerns - Signing transactions for high value accounts should NOT be done on the same device used for casual browsing, messaging, etc.

This is your weekly, weekend reminder that every credential you had in LastPass at this time last year should be considered compromised.

Please prioritize rotating your most valuable / oldest secrets + migrating assets today.

Non-LastPass users should honestly do the same.

üôè

— Tay üíñ (@tayvano_) October 22, 2023

EtherHiding & Using Binance Chain to Store Malicious Code


Summary

Threat actors who launch nasty info stealer campaigns are now storing their malicious payloads on Binance Chain. Info stealing malware is designed to steal banking information, login credentials, and credit card information without victims detecting a trace of the malware.

Threat actors are pivoting from using traditional web2 approaches to using web3 technologies to store malicious content, because previous methods are consistently being taken down by hosting services. Although this activity has been catching the attention of the Web3 security community, we must highlight that threat actors have been leveraging decentralized technologies such as IPFS to store malicious content as well.

How users can protect themselves

While this campaign doesn‚Äôt specifically target crypto users, users should incorporate best practices when browsing the internet. This involves keeping your browser and computer updated, using ad-blockers, and not downloading things from people or organizations you do not trust.

Galxe Agrees to Compensate Users 110% After Suffering DNS Hijacking Attack that Led to the Loss of Over $400K


Summary

Galxe compensated users who lost funds after the platform suffered a recent DNS hijacking attack. Galxe‚Äôs domain registrar, Dynadot, provided domain access to an attacker who impersonated members from the official Galxe team. The attacker then turned Galxe‚Äôs front end to a phishing site that impacted 1,120 of Galxe users.

How users can protect themselves

Thankfully MetaMask acted swiftly by temporarily marking Galxe as a phishing site.

Users that were impacted by this attack were compensated 110% of their lost funds on October 20th . Impacted users that have not yet been compensated can contact the Galxe support team for further assistance.

It‚Äôs important for user‚Äôs to stay vigilant when interacting with dapps, even ones they trust. Keeping protocol announcement alerts on, wallets updated, and MetaMask security features (PPOM/BlockAid) enabled are the advised preventative measures.

Developers looking to mitigate DNS hijacking attacks should take a look at our DNS hijacking mitigation proposal. Please provide us your feedback on the proposal here ‚Üí https://feedback.metamask.io/allowlist/

Save the Date: State of Security: MetaMask x Wallet Guard


Our quarterly X (fka Twitter) Space co-hosted by MetaMask and wallet guard will be held on November 29 at 12pm PST. Get the breakdown on the latest threats, best security practices & releases. We hope to see you there! https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1OyKAWmbmdDJb

nodes.title: How to sell crypto
nodes.subtitle: Turn your crypto to cash. In a flash.

image.title: How to sell crypto with MetaMask
image.description: MetaMask makes selling cryptocurrencies fast, easy, and secure. With low fees and seamless off-ramping.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Selling crypto for cash is as simple as can be with MetaMask. You can exchange crypto from MetaMask wallet directly to your debit card, credit card, PayPal, or bank account. No unnecessary steps, no excess fees, no worries.

Below, we'll give you an overview of how we make MetaMask wallet powerful, secure, and configurable when you sell cryptocurrencies. Then, you'll find videos and step-by-step guides showing you how to sell crypto with MetaMask on your browser or mobile app.

Let's get into it! ü¶ä

How MetaMask empowers you

  • Sell directly from your MetaMask wallet, and send cash to the place that works for you.
  • Choose the best quote from our industry-leading aggregator.
  • Avoid centralized exchanges, extra steps, and additional costs.
  • Use MetaMask wallet in 188 countries with over 80 currencies available.
  • Buy crypto, use crypto, and sell crypto. All in one place.

How MetaMask keeps you secure

  • Get 24/7 help whenever you need it from our expert customer service team.
  • We only work with trusted providers, ensuring that they comply with applicable regulations and are legitimate, responsible parties.
  • Preserving your privacy is paramount: MetaMask does not store ‚Äî nor do we have access to ‚Äî any personal information you provide when buying or selling crypto, such as payment details, personal data, or email addresses.
  • Unlike a centralized exchange, neither MetaMask nor our partners have access to the cryptocurrencies after you purchase or transfer them, meaning you can access your assets immediately without a holding period.

How MetaMask gives you choice

  • Choose your preferred destination for your cash including: debit card, credit card, bank transfer, and PayPal.
  • Select your preferred quote and provider.
  • Sell crypto using MetaMask Extension on desktop or the MetaMask app on mobile.

Sell crypto with MetaMask Extension

Click the Buy & Sell button on MetaMask extension to redirect to MetaMask Portfolio. Once there, connect your MetaMask wallet.

  1. Click Move crypto.
  2. Click Sell.
  3. Select your region, and currency ‚Äî located to the right of your wallet address.
  4. Enter the amount of crypto that you want to sell. Example: 0.5 ETH.
  5. Select the account destination you want. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal balance. Availability will depend on your region.
  6. Select the best real-time quote from our industry-leading providers. You'll be securely redirected to the provider‚Äôs website where you may have to share KYC, then directed back to MetaMask Portfolio once you accept the quote.
  7. After returning to MetaMask Portfolio, click Send ETH.
  8. Click Confirm to complete the transaction in your MetaMask wallet.

Note: You can click on Sell to keep track of your order as it is processed. Times may vary depending on provider.

Success! ü¶ä

Sell crypto with MetaMask app

  1. Sign-in to your MetaMask app.
  2. Tap on the menu button‚Äö which has two arrows in opposite directions and is located on the bottom of your homepage screen.
  3. Tap Sell.
  4. Select your region and currency ‚Äî located to the right of your wallet address.
  5. Enter the crypto amount you want to sell. Example: 0.5 ETH.
  6. Tap Send your cash to and select the account destination you want. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal. Availability will depend on your region.
  7. Tap Get quotes to proceed.
  8. Select the best quote from our industry-leading providers. You'll be securely redirected to the provider‚Äôs portal, where you may have to share KYC, then directed back to MetaMask app once you accept the quote.
  9. Review the order summary in your MetaMask app, and tap Confirm to complete the transaction.

Note: You can tap on progress notification to keep track of your order as it is processed. Times may vary depending on provider.

Success! ü¶ä

Ready to get started? If you‚Äôre on desktop, download MetaMask Extension. If you‚Äôre on mobile, download MetaMask app in the Apple Store or Google Store.

Need more help? We got you. Head to MetaMask Support to speak with our team of experts around-the-clock.

nodes.metaDescription: Sell crypto for cash directly to your debit card, credit card, PayPal, or bank account with MetaMask wallet.

nodes.title: How to buy crypto
nodes.subtitle: Go from cash to crypto. All in one place.

image.title: How to buy crypto
image.description: Explore the ways MetaMask makes buying crypto speedy, simple, and secure.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Wondering how to buy crypto, but not sure where to start? You‚Äôve come to the right place. Buying crypto with MetaMask is swift, seamless, and safe. You can use methods like a credit card, debit card, bank account, Apple Pay, Google Pay, or PayPal. No need for centralized exchanges. We‚Äôve cut out all of the unnecessary steps ‚Äî saving you time, and money on excess fees too.

Below, we'll give you an overview of how we make MetaMask wallet powerful, secure, and configurable when you buy cryptocurrencies. Then, you'll find videos and step-by-step guides showing you exactly how to buy crypto with MetaMask on your browser or mobile app.

Let's get into it! ü¶ä

How MetaMask empowers you

  • Buy crypto straight into your MetaMask wallet.
  • Choose the best quote from our industry-leading aggregator.
  • Avoid centralized exchanges, extra steps, and additional costs.
  • Use MetaMask wallet in 188 countries with over 80 currencies available.
  • Select from hundreds of your favorite tokens across 15+ networks including: Ethereum, Linea, Optimism, BNB Chain, Polygon, zkSync, Base, Arbitrum, and Avalanche.
  • Go from cash to crypto back to cash. All in one place.

How MetaMask keeps you secure

  • Get 24/7 help whenever you need it from our expert customer service team.
  • We only work with trusted providers, ensuring that they comply with applicable regulations and are legitimate, responsible parties.
  • Preserving your privacy is paramount: MetaMask does not store ‚Äî nor do we have access to ‚Äî any personal information you provide when buying or selling crypto, such as payment details, personal data, or email addresses.
  • Unlike a centralized exchange, neither MetaMask nor our partners have access to the cryptocurrencies after you purchase or transfer them, meaning you can access your assets immediately without a holding period.

How MetaMask gives you choice

  • Choose your preferred way to buy crypto: debit card, credit card, bank transfer, instant ACH, PayPal, Apple Pay, Google Pay, Ideal, SEPA bank transfers, and alternative local payment methods. These are subject to availability based on your region.
  • Select your preferred quote and provider.
  • Using MetaMask Extension on desktop or the MetaMask app on mobile.

Buy crypto with MetaMask Extension

Clicking the Buy & Sell button on the MetaMask extension will redirect you to MetaMask Portfolio. Once there, connect your MetaMask wallet.

  1. Click Move crypto.
  2. Click Buy.
  3. Select your region, and currency ‚Äî located to the right of your wallet address.
  4. Select the crypto token, and network that you want to buy on. Example: ETH on Ethereum.
  5. Enter the amount you want to buy. Example: 0.5 ETH Example: $100 of ETH.
  6. Select the payment method you want to use to buy crypto. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal balance. Availability will depend on your region.
  7. Select the best real-time quote from our industry-leading providers.
  8. You'll be securely redirected to the provider's website to complete the purchase, and funds will be deposited into your MetaMask wallet.

Success! ü¶ä

Buy crypto with MetaMask mobile app

  1. Sign-in to your MetaMask app.
  2. Tap the menu button, which has two arrows in opposite directions and is located on the bottom of your homepage screen.
  3. Tap Buy
  4. Select your region and currency ‚Äî located to the right of your wallet address.
  5. Select the crypto token, and network that you want to buy on. Example: ETH on Ethereum.
  6. Enter the amount you want to buy. Example: 0.5 ETH.
  7. Select the payment method you want to use to buy crypto. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal balance. Availability will depend on your region.
  8. Tap Get quotes to proceed. Select the best quote from our industry-leading providers.
  9. Complete the transaction on the provider‚Äôs portal, and link your desired payment method.
  10. Review the order summary in your MetaMask app, and confirm the transaction to get crypto in your wallet.

Success! ü¶ä

Ready to get started? If you‚Äôre on desktop, download MetaMask Extension. If you‚Äôre on mobile, download MetaMask app for iOS or Android.

Need more help? We got you. Head to MetaMask Support to speak with our team of experts around-the-clock.

nodes.metaDescription: Explore the ways to buy crypto directly using your debit card, credit card, PayPal, and bank account with MetaMask wallet.

nodes.title: Transfers from Coinbase and Binance now available in MetaMask
nodes.subtitle: MetaMask launches new CEX transfer feature to make your wallet more powerful.

image.title: Centralized exchange transfers MetaMask now available
image.description: Centralized exchange transfers from Coinbase and Binance now available on MetaMask.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
MetaMask Portfolio now supports centralized exchange (CEX) transfers from Coinbase and Binance, streamlining the process of transferring assets to your crypto wallet.

Many web3 users have digital assets divided across multiple wallets and accounts, creating a fragmented experience. Moving assets from one platform to another can be overly complicated and involve many steps‚Äîfraught with the risks of copying and pasting addresses incorrectly, and potential security concerns. MetaMask‚Äôs new CEX transfer feature is a solution to this issue, making your wallet more powerful, while also strengthening security.

Instant transfer of assets from centralized exchanges into your MetaMask wallet

MetaMask CEX transfers allow you to immediately move assets between accounts, eliminating the need for manually entering addresses. And, if you have bank accounts linked to your Coinbase or Binance accounts, purchasing crypto directly with your bank account to your MetaMask wallet has never been easier. No additional KYC necessary.

In April 2024, MetaMask partnered with Meld and Mesh to launch a feature that allowed users to track external CEX balances by linking Coinbase or Binance accounts directly from the MetaMask Portfolio dashboard. Now, you can view CEX balances, and also transfer assets from these exchanges into your MetaMask wallet. Neither MetaMask, nor our partners in this integration, will ever have access to your exchange login credentials, or share your wallet addresses with third parties.

CEX transfers will initially support Coinbase or Binance accounts, with expansion to additional exchanges on the horizon. No fees will be charged when transferring digital assets from exchanges to MetaMask. A nominal transaction fee of 0.25% will be applied when transferring from MetaMask to centralized exchanges. Network gas fees also apply.

By bridging the gap between self-custodial and centralized platforms, MetaMask is paving the way for a more powerful, integrated, and user-friendly DeFi ecosystem. Head to MetaMask Portfolio today to get started with CEX transfers.

nodes.metaDescription: MetaMask launches new CEX transfer feature to make your wallet more powerful.
